backend/main.mo: Empty Motoko actor serving as the backend entry point with no implemented functionality.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report confirming the Google Site Verification meta tag has been added to frontend/index.html, mapped to test REQ-46 with high confidence.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON document containing short summaries of all frontend source files, describing each component's purpose, styles, and key functionality.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS entry file defining CSS custom property tokens for light and dark themes including colors, radius, chart, and sidebar variables.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point for the QuickRepair app including viewport meta, SEO description, and the Google Site Verification meta tag, mounting the React app at #root.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component that composes Navbar, Hero, Services, AboutUs, ContactUs, Footer, and FloatingButtons into the full single-page layout.
frontend/src/components/AboutUs.tsx: About section displaying four feature cards (Verified Mechanics, 10 Min Guarantee, Cash on Delivery, No Hidden Charges) and a stats bar with customer and mechanic counts.
frontend/src/components/BookingForm.tsx: Empty file placeholder for the booking form component.
frontend/src/components/BookingHistory.t: Empty file placeholder for the booking history component.
frontend/src/components/ContactUs.tsx: Contact section with clickable cards for phone, email, working hours, and WhatsApp, plus a service areas grid listing six coverage locations.
frontend/src/components/EmergencySOS.tsx: Empty file placeholder for the Emergency SOS component.
Fixed floating action buttons at bottom-right providing quick access to WhatsApp and phone call for QuickRepair.
frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx: Responsive footer with QuickRepair branding, contact details, smooth-scroll quick links, a services price list, copyright notice, and a caffeine.ai attribution.
frontend/src/components/Hero.tsx: Full-screen hero section with animated gradient background, floating brand heading, tagline, trust badges, and CTA buttons for viewing services or booking via WhatsApp.
frontend/src/components/InAppChat.tsx: Empty file placeholder for the in-app chat component.
frontend/src/components/LiveTracking.tsx: Empty file placeholder for the live tracking component.
frontend/src/components/Navbar.tsx: Responsive navigation bar with smooth-scroll links, a slide-in mobile menu, scroll-aware background, and a WhatsApp deep-link for mechanic registration.
frontend/src/components/Services.tsx: Displays a grid of five fixed-price home services (plumber, electrician, etc.) where clicking a card opens a pre-filled WhatsApp booking message, plus a general WhatsApp CTA button.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React Query hook that creates and caches an ICP backend actor, using an anonymous actor when unauthenticated and an identity-bound actor when logged in, invalidating dependent queries on actor change.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an Internet Identity authentication context and provider using DFINITY's AuthClient, exposing login/clear functions and status flags via a React context hook.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Placeholder file that exports nothing, noting that no backend queries are needed for this frontend-only application.
frontend/src/index.css: Global stylesheet defining CSS custom properties for the brand palette, Tailwind utility aliases, and custom animations (hero gradient, card fade-in, WhatsApp pulse button, etc.).
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that mounts the React app wrapped with React Query's QueryClientProvider and the InternetIdentityProvider.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration extending the default theme with brand colors (navy, orange, yellow), custom shadows, border radii, and named keyframe animations matching the global CSS.
project_state.json: Tracks the current state of the QuickRepair single-page website project (version 13), including business details, service prices, architectural notes, and a list of implemented features. Serves as the source of truth for build planning and feature history.
